item.title: R to @quant_arb: I see people argue about what to learn but there's plenty of roadmaps out there just through uni programmes or masters programmes.
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description: I see people argue about what to learn but there's plenty of roadmaps out there just through uni programmes or masters programmes.

item.title:
You can always just find the programme for any quant finance degree and just learn the material on your own time if you want to brush up on quant math in a structured way.
https://www.lse.ac.uk/study-at-lse/undergraduate/degree-programmes-2024/bsc-financial-mathematics-and-statistics
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description:
You can always just find the programme for any quant finance degree and just learn the material on your own time if you want to brush up on quant math in a structured way.

item.title: RT by @quant_arb: Just heard of a prop shop in HK that has their trading platform in Python. It takes them 1-2 days to run 1 backtest, ouch.

item.title: The latest article shows how to build a pricing model for options market making using SSVI & Orc Wing (a model Optiver used to use that is much more advanced than existing academic 'cutting edge').

item.title:
Looking for a network / low-latency engineer for hft trading firm role.
Specifically, someone familiar with latency optimization on the network side, not the tick-to-trade (compute) side.
Ping with CV if interested in details (send photo of CV to DM, not link to PDF)
item.dc:creator: @quant_arb
item.description:
Looking for a network / low-latency engineer for hft trading firm role.

Specifically, someone familiar with latency optimization on the network side, not the tick-to-trade (compute) side.

Ping with CV if interested in details (send photo of CV to DM, not link to PDF)
